revised_title: Boiling Point and Composition in Organic Compounds: A Study by Hermann Kopp
tldr: In this study, Hermann Kopp investigates the relationship between boiling points and composition in organic compounds. He found that the same difference in composition often corresponds to the same difference in boiling point. Kopp's research helps to calculate boiling points of alcohols, acids, and compound ethers, and provides a foundation for understanding the behavior of other organic compounds.
